items.title: pyexcel-xls conflict with pyexcel-xlsx
items.body: When both installed, reading https://www.edd.ca.gov/Jobs_and_Training/warn/WARN_Report.xlsx using pyexcel-xls will be stuck.

items.title: Is possible to save sheet with style?
items.body: Let's say i have a worksheet and i want to add/edit some content, is possible to save with the style?

items.title: XLS to BytesIO response stream created on the fly
items.body:
I'm trying to create response stream with XLS file created on the fly, but only first call to save_to_memory is shown in the downloaded file

The result of the following example is XLS file with only one row of data (instead of 4):



```
import io
import pyexcel as pe
from aiohttp import web

async def get(request):
  response = web.StreamResponse(headers={'Content-Disposition': 'inline; filename="myfile.xls"'})
  await response.prepare(request)
  response.content_type = 'multipart/x-mixed-replace;boundary=ffserver'
  data = [1,2,3,4]
  mem = io.BytesIO()
  sheet = pe.Sheet(name='ids', colnames=['id'])

  try:
      for id in data:
         sheet.extend_rows([id])
         mem = sheet.save_to_memory("xls", mem)
         await response.write(mem.read())
  finally:
      await response.write_eof()
```

Is it even possible doing so with this file format? 

Thanks

items.title: Incompatibility with pyexcel-io v0.5.12
items.body:
It seems that pyexcel-io v0.5.12, in 43a5a56227128fbdcc39b6a2932571aac0f1adbd got rid of io.store_data(). Unfortunately, that entry point is imported by pyexcel-xls (and pyexcel-xlsx). A patch like this is needed to allow the import to work (but I'm not 100% sure if there is any more to it than this):

```
$ diff /usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/pyexcel_xls/__init__.py.saved /usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/pyexcel_xls/__init__.py
14c14
< from pyexcel_io.io import get_data as read_data, isstream, store_data as write_data
---
> from pyexcel_io.io import get_data as read_data, isstream, save_data as write_data
```

items.title: 5.8.0 tag should be v5.8.0
items.body:
https://github.com/pyexcel/pyexcel-xls/releases/tag/0.5.8 is inconsistently named.
Or is this a new naming convention?

items.title: How to detect merged cell in .xls
items.body:
I have a similar situation as in this SO question about reading merged cell values and have it apply to subsequent rows in .xls files https://stackoverflow.com/a/30753988/80353

I wonder if there's a way to do it using pyexcel-xls API **without resorting to the answer** given in the SO question?

items.title: formatting_info=True not implemented
items.body:
```
    ragged_rows=ragged_rows,
  File "/home/travis/virtualenv/python3.6.3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/xlrd/xlsx.py", line 794, in open_workbook_2007_xml
    raise NotImplementedError("formatting_info=True not yet implemented")
NotImplementedError: formatting_info=True not yet implemented
```

means pyexcel-xls cannot skip hidden rows and columsn in xlsx format. In this case, please use pyexcel-xlsx.

items.title: To support hidden row and hidden column
items.body:
self._native_sheet has colinfo_map and rowinfo_map for checking if there is any hidden row/column.

Reference: https://github.com/pyexcel/pyexcel/issues/53

items.title: Cannot read from url: AttributeError: addinfourl instance has no attribute 'seek'
items.body:
Hello there,

I am trying to read a book using get_book and get following error message:

```
Python 2.7.13 (default, Aug 22 2017, 13:19:02)
[GCC 4.8.5] on linux2
Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.
>>> import pyexcel
>>> book = pyexcel.get_book(url='http://server/filename.xlsx')
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
  File "/opt/python2.7/lib/python2.7/site-packages/pyexcel/core.py", line 46, in get_book
    book_stream = sources.get_book_stream(**keywords)
  File "/opt/python2.7/lib/python2.7/site-packages/pyexcel/internal/core.py", line 33, in get_book_stream
    sheets = a_source.get_data()
  File "/opt/python2.7/lib/python2.7/site-packages/pyexcel/plugins/sources/http.py", line 58, in get_data
    **self._keywords)
  File "/opt/python2.7/lib/python2.7/site-packages/pyexcel/plugins/parsers/excel.py", line 21, in parse_file_stream
    file_stream, file_type=self._file_type, **keywords)
  File "/opt/python2.7/lib/python2.7/site-packages/pyexcel/plugins/parsers/excel.py", line 35, in _parse_any
    anything, file_type=file_type, **keywords)
  File "/opt/python2.7/lib/python2.7/site-packages/pyexcel_io/io.py", line 65, in get_data
    streaming=False, **keywords)
  File "/opt/python2.7/lib/python2.7/site-packages/pyexcel_io/io.py", line 83, in _get_data
    return load_data(**keywords)
  File "/opt/python2.7/lib/python2.7/site-packages/pyexcel_io/io.py", line 187, in load_data
    result = reader.read_all()
  File "/opt/python2.7/lib/python2.7/site-packages/pyexcel_xls/xlsr.py", line 109, in read_all
    self._native_book = self._get_book()
  File "/opt/python2.7/lib/python2.7/site-packages/pyexcel_xls/xlsr.py", line 128, in _get_book
    self._file_stream.seek(0)
AttributeError: addinfourl instance has no attribute 'seek'
```

If the line "self._file_stream.seek(0)" is removed, then it works.

Would someone please take a look at it?

Best regards,
D

items.title: sdist upload missing in latest PyPI release
items.body: The latest PyPI release (`0.3.3`) just has a wheel, but not a `sdist upload`. I can understand that it is convenient to have a wheel upload, but this breaks some packaging workflows (I build internal debian packages which assume that the source will be present on PyPI). Please consider including it for the current and future releases as done earlier e.g. see [0.3.1](https://pypi.python.org/pypi/pyexcel-xls/0.3.1) which just has the source.

items.title: cannot pass encoding info into xlrd
items.body: The old xls file not always has correct encoding info. Thus it is necessary to use encoding_override option in xlrd. However, It is not possible to set this option inside pyexcel.

What should I do? Thanks!

items.title: file_stream only works on things with getvalue()
items.body:
Using `file_stream` works fine with a CSV file, but dies with an XLS file:
```
>>> import pyexcel
>>> pyexcel.get_records(file_stream=open('foo.csv'), file_type='csv')[0]
{u'A': 1, u'C': 3, u'B': 2, u'E': '', u'D': ''}
>>> pyexcel.get_records(file_stream=open('foo.xls'), file_type='xls')[0]
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
  File ".../lib/python2.7/site-packages/pyexcel/core.py", line 330, in get_records
    **keywords)
  File ".../lib/python2.7/site-packages/pyexcel/core.py", line 67, in get_sheet
    named_content = sources.get_sheet_stream(**keywords)
  File ".../lib/python2.7/site-packages/pyexcel/sources/__init__.py", line 15, in get_sheet_stream
    sheets = source.get_data()
  File ".../lib/python2.7/site-packages/pyexcel/sources/file_source_input.py", line 83, in get_data
    **self.__keywords)
  File ".../lib/python2.7/site-packages/pyexcel_io/io.py", line 38, in get_data
    file_type=file_type, **keywords)
  File ".../lib/python2.7/site-packages/pyexcel_io/io.py", line 148, in load_data
    result = reader.read_all()
  File ".../lib/python2.7/site-packages/pyexcel_xls/xls.py", line 113, in read_all
    self._native_book = self._get_book()
  File ".../lib/python2.7/site-packages/pyexcel_xls/xls.py", line 131, in _get_book
    file_contents=self._file_stream.getvalue(),
AttributeError: 'file' object has no attribute 'getvalue'
```
It looks like the line at https://github.com/pyexcel/pyexcel-xls/blob/771969ec849447440c96b81761c77d47bcd406cb/pyexcel_xls/xls.py#L131 means that only streams that have `getvalue()` (e.g. StringIO) can be used. Could this be extended to work with any file-type object? (I realise in this case I could call read() and pass that to `file_content` but I came across this with a different file-type object.)

```
IOError: No suitable library found for XLS
```

python version 2.7.12

items.title: To support generator as member of the incoming two dimensional data
items.body: Till v0.2.2, pyexcel-xls does not support a list of generators as data content for writing into xls file

items.title: Support hidden sheets
items.body:
the use case is to be able to not read the hidden sheets. 

https://github.com/pyexcel/pyexcel/issues/21

items.title: error in pyexcel-xls setup command: Invalid environment marker: python_version<"3"
items.body:
If you get this error:

```
error in pyexcel-xls setup command: Invalid environment marker: python_version<"3"
```

Please then upgrade setuptools to the latest version

items.title: Support Decimal
items.body:
It would be useful if the writer supported Decimals. Currently I need to manually convert them to float.

```
Exception: Unexpected data type <class 'decimal.Decimal'>
```

https://docs.python.org/3/library/decimal.html

items.title: Data mangling from default float to int if possible
items.body:
[Reading integers from xlrd](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/8825681/integers-from-excel-files-become-floats/8826770#8826770) was rejected. Hence, pyexcel could offer a workaround for it, data-mangling.

reference: https://github.com/pyexcel/pyexcel/issues/32

items.title: ValueError: More than 4094 XFs (styles) # when writing to xls
items.body:
Hi,
Thanks for the excellent library.

I'm getiing this error,
**ValueError: More than 4094 XFs (styles)**
when writing to xls.

Full trace:

```
  File "D:\Tools\Python34\lib\site-packages\pyexcel-0.1.8-py3.4.egg\pyexcel\sheets\sheet.py", line 39, in save_as
    return self.save_to(source)
  File "D:\Tools\Python34\lib\site-packages\pyexcel-0.1.8-py3.4.egg\pyexcel\sheets\sheet.py", line 33, in save_to
    source.write_data(self)
  File "D:\Tools\Python34\lib\site-packages\pyexcel-0.1.8-py3.4.egg\pyexcel\sources\file.py", line 49, in write_data
    raw_sheet.write_array(data_table)
  File "D:\Tools\Python34\lib\site-packages\pyexcel_io\base.py", line 227, in write_array
    self.write_row(r)
  File "D:\Tools\Python34\lib\site-packages\pyexcel_xls\__init__.py", line 189, in write_row
    self.native_sheet.write(self.current_row, i, value, style)
  File "D:\Tools\Python34\lib\site-packages\xlwt\Worksheet.py", line 1033, in write
    self.row(r).write(c, label, style)
  File "D:\Tools\Python34\lib\site-packages\xlwt\Row.py", line 240, in write
    style_index = self.__parent_wb.add_style(style)
  File "D:\Tools\Python34\lib\site-packages\xlwt\Workbook.py", line 323, in add_style
    return self.__styles.add(style)
  File "D:\Tools\Python34\lib\site-packages\xlwt\Style.py", line 94, in add
    return self._add_style(style)[1]
  File "D:\Tools\Python34\lib\site-packages\xlwt\Style.py", line 153, in _add_style
    raise ValueError("More than 4094 XFs (styles)")
ValueError: More than 4094 XFs (styles)
```

Seems to be the same issue as noted here,
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/17130516/xlwt-set-style-making-error-more-than-4094-xfs-styles

The problem is in the method **XLSheetWriter.write_row** in **__init__.py** under **pyexcel_xls**,
a style instance is repeatedly created in a loop,

`style = XFStyle()`

taking it out of the loop fixes the problem,

``` python
class XLSheetWriter(SheetWriter):
    """
    xls, xlsx and xlsm sheet writer
    """
    def set_sheet_name(self, name):
        """Create a sheet
        """
        self.native_sheet = self.native_book.add_sheet(name)
        self.current_row = 0

    def write_row(self, array):
        """
        write a row into the file
        """
        style = XFStyle()  # create only one instance
        for i in range(0, len(array)):
            value = array[i]
            style_assigned = False
            tmp_array = []
            if isinstance(value, datetime.datetime):
                tmp_array = [
                    value.year, value.month, value.day,
                    value.hour, value.minute, value.second
                ]
                value = xlrd.xldate.xldate_from_datetime_tuple(tmp_array, 0)
                style.num_format_str = DEFAULT_DATETIME_FORMAT
                style_assigned = True
            elif isinstance(value, datetime.date):
                tmp_array = [value.year, value.month, value.day]
                value = xlrd.xldate.xldate_from_date_tuple(tmp_array, 0)
                style.num_format_str = DEFAULT_DATE_FORMAT
                style_assigned = True
            elif isinstance(value, datetime.time):
                tmp_array = [value.hour, value.minute, value.second]
                value = xlrd.xldate.xldate_from_time_tuple(tmp_array)
                style.num_format_str = DEFAULT_TIME_FORMAT
                style_assigned = True

            if style_assigned:
                self.native_sheet.write(self.current_row, i, value, style)
            else:
                self.native_sheet.write(self.current_row, i, value)
        self.current_row += 1
```

with regards,
Rafael.

items.title: xlsx file cannot be opened by excel
items.body:
Hello and thanks for this.
I am saving a spreadsheet book created with pyexcel as xlsx and
my excel cannot open it.
If I rename it to xls it opens it without a problem.
I am using:
Microsoft Excel for Mac 2011
Version 14.3.6 (130613)

Thank you,
Andreas
